result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody C. Holm was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Cody C. Holm was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Cody C. Holm is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Cody C. Holm was found guilty of Hit and Run [Modifiers: Penalty-Hit and Run], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

charges.dispoDesc: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

miscConds.notes:
State (Victim Witness Coordinator) in conjunction with Department of Corrections will need to determine the amount of restitution. Defendant will have 30 days to object to the restitution amount.
**10/23/14 /s/TTF:  Restitution is $2,722.85.**

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not operate a vehicle without a valid drivers license. 
Do not operate a vehicle unless absolutely sober.

Department of Corrections will need to determine how to handle since the defendant is a Minnesota resident. 
Defendant is not to leave Portage County until he has met with his probation agent and informed he will need to find a place to stay and behave.

timeConds.notes: (Credit for 80 days served which includes today.)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody C. Holm

and (unsigned) Order for Substitution of Counsel - Atty McFarland for Atty Drury
Jury questions.
Associated with Charge #3

Defendant Cody C. Holm in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Day 2 of Jury Trial

8:29 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances are the same as of September 24, 2014.
Court indicates wanted to go on record prior to the return of the Jury at 9:00 a.m.
State has at least 1 more witness to present evidence and also has a recording to play. 
Atty Mcfarland will wait until after the State has rested to determine if his client will testify.
Court has 1st draft of Verdict/Jury Instructions (not final draft but is hoped to expedite process).
Court will add 158 as State will be playing recording.  No transcripts to be provided to the jurors as per the State the recording is clear.
No other information to be put on the record until the jurors return to the courtroom.
Court is in recess until about 9:00 a.m. 
8:59 a.m.  Exhibit's #19-#21 are marked for Atty Cousins.
9:00 a.m.  Court is back in session.
Nothing to be put on record prior to the return of the juror's.
9:02 a.m.  Juror's have now returned to the courtroom.
9:03 a.m.  Penny Borski is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Cousins.
9:05 a.m.  Exhibit #21 is referenced.
9:07 a.m.  Atty Cousins moves Exhibit #21 into evidence, no objection; Received by the Court.
Atty Mcfarland has no questions for this witness.
Witness is excused.
9:08 a.m.  Deputy Mulrooney is recalled and informed that he is still under oath from September 24, 2014.
Direct examination by Atty Cousins.
9:10 a.m.  Objection by Atty Mcfarland; sustained.
9:11 a.m.  Exhibit #7 is referenced.
9:12 a.m.  Atty Cousins moves Exhibit #7 into evidence, no objection; Received by the Court.
9:14 a.m.  Atty Cousins references #19 & #20.
Atty Cousins asks Deputy Mulrooney to review the copies of transcripts (exhibits #19 & #20).
9:17 a.m.  Atty Cousins requests to play Exhibit #21 (recording of phone conversations).
Court informs the Juror's that recordings are proper evidence and that they need to listen carefully as may not always be easy to understand (Court has been informed that the recordings are clear and easy to understand).
First recording starts at 1:35 to 2:25 - technical difficulty with the recording has occurred.
9:20 a.m.  Atty Mcfarland requests a sidebar.
Juror's are removed from the Courtroom.
Atty Mcfarland states that there are some issues that are prejudicial and had been agreed upon that they will not play some of the recordings.
Atty Cousins states that the recordings are a better reflection of the evidence and would still like to play the portions of the recording.
Court informs the State that the recording needs to be listened to carefully so that a mistrial does not occur as both parties had agreed to play only certain portions of the recording.
9:34 a.m.  Atty Mcfarland makes statement as to when the final recording should be played and when to end.
Court informs the parties that the final recording was not understandable; Atty Mcfarland reads the transcript to the Court.
Atty Cousins agrees to play what the defense is requesting.
9:37 a.m.  Atty Cousins plays call #4 starting at 6:30 and ending at 6:59.
9:38 a.m.  Atty Cousins plays call #9 starting at 1:35 and ending at 2:25.
9:40 a.m.  Atty Cousins plays call #9 starting at 3:15 and ending at 3:45.
Atty Cousins continues with direct examination.
9:42 a.m.  Atty Cousins requests a sidebar.
9:44 a.m.  Atty Cousins continues with direct examination.
Cross examination by Atty Mcfarland.
No re-direct by Atty Cousins.
9:45 a.m.  Witness is excused.
Atty Cousins moves Exhibit's #19 and #20 into evidence, no objection.  Received by the Court.
9:45 a.m.  Jurors are removed from the Courtroom.
Court questions Atty Mcfarland if he will be calling his client to testify.
Atty Mcfarland makes statement requesting a dismissal of this case.
Court makes statements regarding the response of Atty Mcfarland and denies his request to dismiss this case.
9:51 a.m.  Atty Mcfarland states his client will be testifying on his behalf.
Court questions the defendant and defendant states he will testify on his behalf.
9:52 a.m.  Juror's have  returned to the courtroom.
Court explains why the juror's were not able to ask the last 2 witnesses questions; Court inform's he had forgotten this procedure.  Informs the juror's if they would like to ask questions to raise hand and ask if Court forgets.
9:54 a.m.  Cody Holm is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Mcfarland.
9:59 a.m.  Objection by Atty Cousins; overruled.
10:04 a.m.  Exhibit #18 is referenced by Atty Mcfarland.
10:06 a.m.  Atty Mcfarland moves exhibit #18 into evidence, no objection.  Received by the Court.
10:07 a.m.  Objection by Atty Cousins; overruled.
10:08 a.m.  Cross examination by Atty Cousins.
10:19 a.m.  Exhibit #4 is referenced by Atty Cousins.
10:21 a.m.  Re-direct by Atty Mcfarland.
10:22 a.m.  Cross examination by Atty Cousins.
Objection by Atty Mcfarland; overruled.
Court questions Juror's if they have questions.
Parties go back into Judge's chambers for review of questions.
Court ask's the question that had been asked by the Juror.
10:24 a.m.  Witness is excused.
10:25 a.m.  Atty Cousins calls rebuttal witness, Deputy Mulrooney.
Direct examination by Atty Cousins.
10:26 a.m.  Cross examination by Atty Mcfarland.
No questions from the Juror's for this witness.
10:27 a.m.  Witness is excused.
Evidentiary portion of the trial has been completed.
Court inform's the Juror's of the next step in the process. 
10:28 a.m.  Juror's are excused from the courtroom and informed that they have a 1/2 hour break.
Exhibit's #9 & #10 are withdrawn.
Court review's the verdict form's with the parties.
10:31 a.m.  Court reviews the Jury Instructions with the parties.
10:42 a.m.  Atty Cousins states the Jury Instruction 142 should be included; no objection by Atty Mcfarland.
10:43 a.m  Court is in recess. 
11:03 a.m.  Court is back in session.
Parties have nothing to put on the record prior to the Juror's returning.
11:05 a.m.  Court is having Jury Instructions corrected.
Atty Mcfarland states he would like the Heinz chart to go back with the Juror's; Court informs will talk about this information.
11:10 a.m.  Juror's have returned to the courtroom.  Alternate Juror will be excused after the Jury Instructions, as all Juror's have ordered lunch.
11:11 a.m.  Court goes over the Jury Instructions with the Juror's.
11:27 a.m.  Court requests a sidebar.
11:31 a.m.  Court continues the Jury Instructions.
11:34 a.m.  Atty Cousins gives closing argument.
11:58 a.m.  Atty Mcfarland gives closing argument.
12:16 p.m.  Rebuttal by Atty Cousins.
12:31 p.m.  Alternatre Juror is #2427.
Court gives the final Jury Instructions. 
12:35 p.m.  Clerk administers the Oath of Officers.
12:36 p.m.  Juror's are excused to deliberate.
Court makes comments regarding the sidebar requested @ 11:27 a.m. on the record.
Court questions the parties regarding the exhibits and how to proceed with these.
Atty Cousins would request that they wait until the Jury makes the request.
Atty Mcfarland would like the Juror's to have Exhibit #17.
Court states that the expert had in depth testimony regarding the Heinz Chart (#17) and will not send any exhibit's back unless asked for by the Jury.
12:40 p.m.  Court is in recess. 
Court will inform law enforcement when they would like the defendant back in Court.
1:41 p.m.  Court is back in session.
Juror's have a question and are asking to see Exhibit #17.  Page 1 will be removed and Page 2 will be sent back to the Juror's.
Court has separated Exhibit #17 and will now be marked as Exhibit #17 (page 1) and Exhibit #17A (page 2).
1:46 p.m.  Court is in recess.
2:00 p.m.  Court is back in session.
Juror's are back in the courtroom and have a verdict.
Juror's have found the defendant Guilty of hit and run with a motor vehicle.
Juror's have found the defendant Not Guilty of OWI.
Juror's have found the defendant Not Guilty of PAC.
Court thanks the Juror's for their service and excuses them for the day.
Court asks if Amended Information filed.
Will move ahead with Count 3 and enter Judgment of Conviction. 
Atty Mcfarland is asking for dismissal on Count 1 & 2.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 & 2 are dismissed.

Court questions Atty Cousins if the victim wanted to make a statement at sentencing.
Atty Cousins does not know this information.

Parties are ready to proceed to sentencing.
Prosecutor argues regarding sentencing recommendations.
Atty Cousins makes statements regarding restitution but does not have any figures if there is restitution involved.
Atty Cousins is requesting 6 month jail sentence with fine and restitution.
Attorney for Defendant argues regarding sentencing recommendations.
Atty Mcfarland makes statements regarding the fact that his client has been in jail since he had been picked up in July 2014.
Atty Mcfarland is requesting time served with payment of restitution.
Court asks the Defendant if he/she wants to make any statements.
Defendent makes statements on his behalf before sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 3 -
Impose/Stay a 6 month jail sentence
Restitution ordered - State (Victim Witness Coordinator) in conjunction with Department of Corrections will need to determine the amount of the restitution.
Defendant will have 30 days to object to the restitution amount.
Probation for 12 months - Department of Corrections will need to determine how to handle since the defendant is a Minnesota resident
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.
Do not operate a vehicle unless absolutely sober.
80 days in county jail
Credit for 80 days served which includes today
Defendant is not to leave Portage County until he has met with his probation agent and informed he will need to find a place to stay and behave
Pay costs which include the victim witness surcharge and filing fee
20 days to appeal

Defendant Cody C. Holm in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Mulrooney appears as well.
Matter is set today, the first day of a two day jury trial.

8:48 AM Court calls case.
Court welcomes all jurors.
Court reads part of the criminal information.
Court introduces all parties.
Court announces the names of all witnesses.

8:53 AM Voir Dire Oath is given to all potential jurors.

8:54 AM Clerk draws 23 potential jurors.

9:04 AM Voir Dire by the Court.
Exhibits #1-#16 are marked on behalf of the Plaintiff.
Juror #2502 is excused for cause and is replaced by Juror #2546.
Juror #2546 is excused for cause and is replaced by Juror #2398.
Juror #2398 has been given the hearing device.

9:30 AM Parties and Juror #2398 all retire to chambers to continue Voir Dire.
Voir Dire by the Court.
Voir Dire by Atty Cousins.
Court will limit voir dire to 10 minutes for each party.

9:34 AM Court and all parties return to the courtroom.
Juror #2398 is excused for cause and is replaced by Juror #2441.
Voir Dire by the Court continues.

9:38 AM Voir Dire by Atty Cousins.
9:49 AM Voir Dire by Atty McFarland.

10:03 AM Parties and Juror #2512 all retire to chambers to continue Voir Dire.
Voir Dire by the Court.
Neither counsel have objection for excusing this Juror.

10:06 AM Court and all parties return to the courtroom.
Juror #2512 is excused for cause and is replaced by Juror #2404.

Court Voir Dires Juror #2404.
Juror #2404 is excused for cause and is replaced by Juror #2444.
10:10 AM Court Voir Dires Juror #2444.

10:12 AM Strikes are held at this time.

Jurors picked to try this case are:
Juror #2418 R.Z.
Juror #2423 G.M.
Juror #2425 B.J.
Juror #2427 C.L.
Juror #2444 S.G.
Juror #2468 K.L.
Juror #2476 D.B.
Juror #2479 E.B.H.
Juror #2482 B.Z.
Juror #2510 J.R.
Juror #2517 B.B.
Juror #2525 C.M.
Juror #2526 W.H.

10:21 AM Court thanks and excuses remaining Jurors that were not chosen.
10:22 AM Clerk administers Jurors Oath to all 13 jurors.
10:23 AM Court addresses the Jurors, reviews instructions.

10:33 AM Court will take a 20 minute recess at this time. Court reviews rules regarding breaks.

10:58 AM Court is back on the record, same appearances, outside the presence of the jury.
There were some motions in liminie that the parties discussed off the record. There was no disagreement among any of them.
Court states the State's motions in limine, for the record. There were no objections to these motions.
Parties continue discussions regard the motions, for the record.
Defense stipulates that this is a 4th offense.
Court reviews Defense's motions in limine, for the record. 

Atty Cousins states a plea has not been taken on Count 3.
State has filed an amended information on this case, including the charge of hit and run of unattended vehicle. 
Defense has received a copy of the information, wavies reading.
Atty McFarland enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on Count 3.
Atty McFarland does not object to having this charge tried today.
Defendant will proceed to trial on all three counts.

11:09 AM Jurors enter the courtroom.

11:11 AM Atty Cousins gives opening statements.
11:20 AM Atty McFarland gives opening statements.
11:23 AM Court gives instructions to the Jurors.

Notepads and pencils are distributed to the Jurors.

11:28 AM Jeffrey Langenhahn is called and sworn in, driver of van.
Direct examination by Atty Cousins.
Exhibits #11 and #12 are referred to.
Exhibits #11 and #12 are offered and received and published to the Jury.
Exhibit #16 is referred to.
11:38 AM Cross-examination by Atty McFarland.
11:41 AM Jury has a question. Court and counsel retire to the hallway to review question. 
11:44 AM Court and counsel return to the courtroom.  Question will be answered with subsequent witnesses.
11:45 AM Witness is excused from this subpoena.

11:45 AM Trevin Szulczewski is called and sworn in, WI State Patrol Trooper.
Direct examination by Atty Cousins.
Exhibits #1 and #2 are referred to.
Exhibits #1 and #2 are offered and received. Exhibit #2 is published.
Exhibits #11 and #12 are referred to. Exhibit #13 is referred to, is offered and received. 
Exhibits #14-#16 are referred to. Exhibits #14-#16 are offered and received.
11:56 AM Cross-examination by Atty McFarland.
11:57 AM Re-direct by Atty Cousins.

11:58 AM Witness is excused from subpoena.

11:59 AM Court excuses jurors for lunch, will pick up at 1:15 pm.
All exhibits offered and received are accounted for.

1:23 PM Court calls case. 
Same appearances as this morning.
Neither party has anything to put on the record.

1:24 PM Jurors enter the Courtroom.

1:25 PM Michael Morgan is called and sworn in, Lt with Portage County Sheriff's Department.
Direct examination by Atty Cousins.
Exhibits #13 and #2 and #14-#16 are referred to. 
Defense has no questions.
1:38 PM Jury has a question.  Court and counsel retire to the hallway to review question. 
1:39 PM Court and counsel return.
1:40 PM Court reads Jury question to witness.
Witness answers.
1:41 PM Cross-examination by Atty McFarland.
1:41 PM Witness is excused from subpoena.

1:42 PM Matt Gumney is called and sworn in, deputy with Portage County Sheriff's Department.
Direct examination by Atty Cousins.
Exhibit #6 is referred to. Exhibit #6 is offered and received.
1:47 PM Defense has no questions. Jurors have no questions.
1:47 PM Witness is excused from subpoena.

1:48 PM Tabatha Spencer is called and sworn in, witness to car crash.
Direct examination by Atty Cousins.
1:52 PM Cross-examination by Atty McFarland.
1:54 PM Witness is excused.

1:55 PM Samantha Wilson is called and sworn in, mother of previous witness, witness to car crash.
Direct examination by Atty Cousins.
1:59 PM Cross-examination by Atty McFarland.
2:00 PM Re-direct by Atty Cousins.
2:01 PM Jurors have questions.  Court and counsel retire to the hallway to review questions. 
2:03 PM Court and counsel return.
2:04 PM Court reads Jurors questions to witness.
Witness answers.
2:05 PM Witness is excused.

2:06 PM Cathy Noth is called and sworn in, county resident.
Direct examination by Atty Cousins.
Witness identifies Defendant.
2:13 PM Cross-examination by Atty McFarland.
2:15 PM Re-direct by Atty Cousins.
2:16 PM Re-cross by Atty McFarland.
2:16 PM Jurors have questions. Court and counsel retire to the hallway to review questions.
2:17 PM Court and counsel return.
2:17 PM Court reads Jurors questions to witness.
Witness answers.
2:19 PM Witness is excused from subpoena.

2:20 PM David Piesik is called and sworn in, county resident.
Direct examination by Atty Cousins.
Witness identifies Defendant.
Exhibit #2 is referred to.
2:28 PM Cross-examination by Atty McFarland.
2:33 PM Re-direct by Atty Cousins.
2:33 PM There are no questions by the jurors. Witness is excused from subpoena.

2:34 PM Joseph Mulrooney is called and sworn in, deputy with Portage County Sheriff's Office.
Direct examination by Atty Cousins.
Exhibit #3 is referred to.
Exhibit #3 is offered and received.
Witness identifies Defendant.
Exhibits #4 and #5 are referred to.
State may recall this witness but has no further questions.
3:00 PM Cross-examination by Atty McFarland.
3:01 PM Re-direct by Atty Cousins.
3:02 PM Jurors have questions. Court and counsel retire to the hallway to review questions.
3:06 PM Court and counsel return.
3:06 PM Court addresses the Jurors. A legal issue has been raised due to one of the questions.

3:07 PM Court will take a 20 minute recess.
Exhibit #17 is marked on behalf of Defense prior to the start of Court.

3:33 PM Court is back in session, outside the prsesence of the jury.
Court reviews the written questions for the record.
Atty McFarland addresses the Court regarding the question.
Atty Cousins addresses the Court.
Parties continue discussions.
Atty McFarland requests a mistrial at this time for reasons stated on the record.
Discussions continue.

Court refers to a curative instruction that Deputy Mulrooney referred to this case involving a felony classification offense, such testimony is stricken from the record by the Court and are to disregard it completely. 

Parties address the Court as to this instruction.

Court will add another sentence to the instructions, read for the record.

3:54 PM Jurors return to the Courtroom.
There were two juror questions, one the Court is allowing and one the Court is not allowing.

3:55 PM Court reads question to Deputy Mulrooney.
Witness answers.
There are no follow up.

Court gives an instruction regarding Deputy Mulrooney's testimony to the Jurors.

3:57 PM Heather Jazdzewski is called and sworn in, medical laboratory technician.
Direct examination by Atty Cousins.
Exhibit #5 is referred to.
4:02 PM Witness is excused from subpoena.

4:03 PM Billie Robbins is called and sworn in, employed at WI State Crime Lab.
Direct examination by Atty Cousins.
Exhibits #5 and #8 are referred to.
Exhibits #4, #5 and #8 are offered and received.
4:12 PM Cross-examination by Atty McFarland.
Exhibit #17 is referred to.
Exhibit #17 is offered and received.
4:20 PM Re-direct by Atty Cousins.
4:26 PM Witness is excused from subpoena.

4:27 PM Court is done for the day. Court will excuse Jurors for the evening. Court reminds Jurors about previous instructions. 

Jurors are to return at 9:00 AM tomorrow.

State will be recalling Deputy Mulrooney. State may have one other witness to call. State may not be playing phone recordings.
Court will hand out jury instructions at about 8:15 AM tomorrow, and discuss anything before going on the record. 

4:31 PM Court is adjourned.
Exhibit #18 is marked on behalf of Defendant.
